attributes.action: Aren't we entitled to freedom? Then why are HM Revenue deciding when and if we can have what we earn!
attributes.additional_details:
We are entitled to receive the money that we earn, even when it is taxed we should be entitled to have the freedom of deciding when we want to receive our income.

As a student I am not in the financial position that I would like to be in and therefore lack money. We work part time to ensure that we can actually live as well as study for degree that contribute to society and the economy by gaining work. Why is it that when a mistake is made, for example, the wrong tax code, that we have to suffer from it and wait 6 or more weeks for the issue to be resolved? Shouldn't we have the right to say when we need our money! After all, didn't we earn it?

I want change:

- Rights over rebate timing/schedules
- Choice over cheque or bank
